content: How can I help you today?

I've been struggling a lot with sleep lately. My mind just doesn't stop racing at night, and it's been hard to relax. Work has been really stressful, and I can't help but worry about everything, especially providing for my family. My partner suggested I see you, so here I am.

Thank you for sharing that. It sounds like you're carrying a lot on your shoulders right now, and it's affecting your sleep. Stress, work responsibilities, and family worries can definitely weigh heavily. How are these struggles impacting your day-to-day life?

Honestly, it’s making everything harder. I feel exhausted all the time, and it’s tough to focus at work, which just makes me more anxious about losing my job. At home, I’m trying to keep it together for my partner and kids, but I feel like I’m failing them too. It’s overwhelming.

It sounds like you're doing your best to hold everything together, even while feeling overwhelmed and drained. It’s clear how much you care about your family and your job, and how important they are to you. What keeps you going through all of this?

It really is my family. I want to make sure my partner and kids are taken care of, no matter how hard it gets. They’re my motivation, but at the same time, I worry about letting them down, and that just adds to the stress. I feel like I’m stuck in this cycle I can’t break.

Your family is clearly so important to you, and it's inspiring that they motivate you to keep going even when things feel tough. At the same time, it sounds like the worry about letting them down weighs heavily on you, adding to the pressure. What kind of difference would it make if you could break free from that cycle?

I think it would change everything. If I could just relax and not constantly stress about work or providing for my family, I feel like I could sleep better, focus more, and just be more present for them. Right now, it feels like I’m always one step away from everything falling apart, and that’s exhausting.

It sounds like finding a way to relax and ease the stress could bring you the rest, focus, and connection you're hoping for with your family. That sense of exhaustion and fear of everything falling apart must be so hard to carry. What do you think might help you start moving toward that place of calm and balance?

I honestly don’t know exactly what would help right now. I’ve tried to just push through or tell myself not to worry, but it doesn’t really work. Maybe just finding a way to quiet my mind at night would be a good start, but I’m not sure how to even do that.

It sounds like you’ve been trying to cope in your own ways but haven’t found something that helps yet, and that’s understandable given everything you’re juggling. Starting with quieting your mind at night could be one step toward feeling a little more in control. What kind of things have you tried before to relax, even if they haven’t fully worked?

Well, I’ve tried things like watching TV until I fall asleep, but that just keeps my mind going more. I’ve also tried reading or scrolling on my phone, but honestly, it doesn’t seem to help either. It’s like no matter what, the thoughts just keep coming.

You’ve been trying different ways to settle your mind, but none of them seem to stop those racing thoughts. That must be frustrating, especially when you're looking for some relief. What do you think it is about the thoughts that make them hard to quiet?

I think it’s because they’re all tied to things I’m really worried about—like work, money, and my family. It’s like my brain just won’t shut off because I feel like I need to figure everything out or fix things, even when I know there’s nothing I can do about it in the moment. It feels impossible to let go.

It makes sense that these thoughts are tied to things you deeply care about, and it’s hard for your mind to let go when you want to fix or protect what matters most. That constant need to solve everything sounds exhausting. What might it be like to give yourself some space, even temporarily, from having to figure it all out—just enough to help your mind and body rest?

I think giving myself that space would help a lot, but I don’t know how to actually do it. Every time I try to relax or push the thoughts away, they just come back even stronger. It’s like my brain doesn’t know how to pause, and I don’t know how to guide it to that place.

It sounds like you're longing for that pause—for your brain to step back—but it’s hard to find a way to actually guide it there. That cycle of trying to relax and thoughts coming back stronger must feel defeating. What do you imagine a moment of real rest or calm would look or feel like for you?

I think it would feel like peace, like my chest isn’t so tight and my mind isn’t running. Just a moment where I could sit and not feel consumed by worry. I don't even know if that's possible for me, though—it feels so far away right now.

That sounds like a powerful image—a moment where you could feel peace, free from worry, and even breathe a little easier. While it feels far away right now, even imagining it shows the strong desire you have for that calm. What do you think might help bring that feeling a little closer, even just one small step?

Maybe practicing something small like deep breathing or taking a moment to write my thoughts down before bed could help. I’ve never tried anything like that before, but it seems like it might make a difference. I’m really not sure where to start though.

Those are thoughtful ideas—deep breathing or writing down your thoughts could be small steps toward easing your mind before bed. Starting with something simple might feel less overwhelming and still give you that space you’re looking for. Would you like to explore one of those more or talk about how it might fit into your evenings?
